benchmark_details.name: BLIP3-KALE
benchmark_details.overview: KALE is a dataset of 218 million image-text pairs that bridges the gap between descriptive synthetic captions and factual web-scale alt-text, creating knowledge-augmented captions for improved performance on vision-language tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale dataset that enhances knowledge-augmented image captioning for better performance in multimodal tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The data still suffers from hallucination, particularly in text-dense images.

data.source: Generated using a two-stage process with vision-language models and language models.
data.annotation: Automatically generated and augmented using web-scale alt-text.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on downstream performance tests across various vision-language benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance, with KALE outperforming previous datasets.
